resources.string:
2 to 3 lectures will be released every week.
There are In-Class Quizzes, Assignments, Notes along with Lecture Videos in a lecture.
You should attempt them all to master each section that you study.
You should complete the lectures within the week.

After almost every lecture there will be one assignment.\nAssignments will have deadlines. Submissions after deadline will be subject to penalty (Penalty procedure is explained separately).\nApart from assignments there will be frequent tests analysing your concepts and understanding.

Apart from instructors taking the course, there are teaching assistants in the course who will be taking your doubts.
You can ask doubt on any content that you are facing problem at, be it a video or a question.
There is an “Ask Doubt” button on the top right corner to raise your doubt.
For doubt resolution TA support will be available between 6PM evening till 12AM midnight, on all seven days.

For many assignment problems, there are hint videos which you can watch. Watching them won\'t add any penalty.\nYou can watch solution videos also for some problems and can check the solution code. But after checking/watching the solution, further submissions to that question will not fetch you any marks.

For every Assignment, there is a soft deadline which is mentioned in every assignment. That is - if you submit problems in your assignment within the soft deadline of its release, you can get the full score for problems (if all the testcases for the problem are passed).\nFor next 10 days (after deadline), a penalty of 25% will be applied on your problem submissions i.e. maximum score that you can get is 0.75*total_score.\nFor next 5 days a penalty of 50% will be applied on your submission, so maximum possible score for a problem will be 0.5*total_score. And after that, you won’t get any marks for your submissions.

Lecture Videos in the course will be accessible by for next five weeks from the release date of the last lecture of the course.\nHint/Solution Videos, quizzes, questions within a lecture, assignments and notes are available to you for lifetime.

All the lecture questions, quizzes and assignments are graded. Submissions after deadlines will be penalised as per the penalty scheme specified above.
Under “Your Percentage Score” you can see your 'With' and 'Without' penalty score. "With penalty score" is your final score considered for leaderboard and certificates.
“Without penalty score” is your score without any penalties applied to the score, which just indicates your total progress in the course.
A leaderboard is maintained for the batch which you can see under overview section in your course. Based on your score you can check your class rank.

After the module ends all those students whose “With Penalty Score” >= 60% will be awarded course certificates.\nYou will have to fill in your details for the certificate. Option to fill certificates details is right below “Resume to Classroom”.\nAfter the course ends, you will see an option to download your certificate right below “Resume to Classroom”.
Ultimately, PRACTICE IS THE KEY!\nThe more you practice, better will be the results. Also, avoid missing lectures.\nWe wish all the best in this journey of codes! Keep coding :)]
Doubts cannot be created in Trials!

Leaderboard not available for this course!!

• Sign in to play the contest from 30th May 2019 to 14th July 2019.
• For each match, make three predictions - guess the winning team, score of winning team and total number of sixes in the match.
• Predictions once made cannot be changed or modified.
• For each match, Top predictors with correct daily prediction will win the daily points. A lucky draw will be done in case of a tie.
• Coding Blocks decision will be final in case of any discrepency.
